who may be arrested after the hours in which the
Recorders' Courts are in session, shall be taken to
the Police Station House of the Policeman who
may make the arrest.
Sec. 16. Any property stolen or embezzled
which shall be found in the possession of any
person who may be arrested, shall be taken to the
Recorder's Court or Police Station House, as the
case may be, with the person arrested, unless
otherwise ordered by the Mayor or Chief of
Police.
Sec. 17. All property which shall come into
the possession of Policemen, whether stolen or lost,
shall be taken to the Police Station House and delivered to the officer there in charge; all articles
delivered to the officer in charge, as stated above,
shall,previous to their del very, be marked by the
Policeman, so that he may be able to identify them
afterwards; nor shall he deliver them until the
officer shall have made an entry in the proper
book of said articles, the Policeman having previously called out the description of the articles
for that purpose.
Sec. 18.
